definitions.definition: A burden ; a weight to be carried.
examples: I struggled up the hill with the heavy load in my rucksack.

definitions.definition: ( figuratively ) A worry or concern to be endured, especially in the phrase a load off one's mind .
A certain number of articles or quantity of material that can be transported or processed at one time.
examples: The truck overturned while carrying a full load of oil.
She put another load of clothes in the washing machine.

definitions.definition: A quantity of washing put into a washing machine for a wash cycle.
examples: I put a load on before we left.

definitions.definition: ( in combination ) Used to form nouns that indicate a large quantity, often corresponding to the capacity of a vehicle
( often in the plural , colloquial ) A large number or amount.
examples: I got loads of presents for my birthday!
I got a load of emails about that.

definitions.definition: The volume of work required to be performed.
examples: Will our web servers be able to cope with that load ?

definitions.definition: ( engineering ) The force exerted on a structural component such as a beam, girder, cable etc.
examples: Each of the cross-members must withstand a tensile load of 1,000 newtons.

definitions.definition: ( electrical engineering ) The electrical current or power delivered by a device.
examples: I'm worried that the load on that transformer will be too high.

definitions.definition: ( engineering ) A resistive force encountered by a prime mover when performing work.
( electrical engineering ) Any component that draws current or power from an electrical circuit.
examples: Connect a second 24-ohm load across the power supply's output terminals.

definitions.definition: A unit of measure for various quantities.
Ellipsis of viral load .
A very small explosive inserted as a gag into a cigarette or cigar .
The charge of powder for a firearm ; a loaded cartridge or round of ammunition .
( obsolete ) Weight or violence of blows.
( vulgar , slang ) defecation
( vulgar , slang ) The contents (e.g. semen ) of an ejaculation .
( euphemistic ) Nonsense; rubbish.
( computing ) The process of loading something, i.e. transferring it into memory or over a network, etc.
examples: All of those uncompressed images are going to slow down the page load .

definitions.definition: ( Philippines ) prepaid phone credit

definitions.definition: A person that spends all day online. The term was originally used in the late 1980s to describe users on free Q-Link (later America Online) accounts who never signed off the system at great expense to the company.
examples: She never logs off; she is a real LOAD !

main_definition: ( Internet slang , obsolete ) A person that spends all day online. The term was originally used in the late 1980s to describe users on free Q-Link (later America Online) accounts who never signed off the system at great expense to the company.
